meaningMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>quantity</kanji>, but you don't "to quantity." To figure out the quantity, however, you have <vocabulary>to measure</vocabulary> / <vocabulary>to weigh</vocabulary> whatever it is you want to get the quantity of.
readingMnemonic: You need <vocabulary>to measure</vocabulary> the quantity of something, but don't have a scale or anything. Luckily, you are quite the <reading>hacker</reading> (はか) and hack together a scale using only rubber bands and beans.
